label: 我執驕慢
本: The Seven Tengu Scrolls: Evil and the Rhetoric of Legitimacy in Medieval Japanese Buddhism . University of Hawai'i Press . 2012
説明文: For their arrogance, they are turned into tengu (天狗). The texts of the first five scrolls repeatedly mention ego-attachment" (gashū) and "arrogance" (kyōman), or attachment to one's own temple and sect. Those "with arrogance and deep attachment in the heart" fall into tengudō (天狗道) instead of achieving ōjō (往生)."
